ap 04:56|"four fifty-six"|"BRIAN’S INTERNAL CLOCK ALMOST ALWAYS WOKE HIM at four fifty-six
column2: giving him four whole minutes to luxuriate in the naked human body next to him. Then the Braun alarm clock on the nightstand would activate his wife with its genteel Nazi toot-ling
column3: and her morning marathon would begin."|"Significant Others"|"Armistead Maupin"

column1: ap 06:00|six|"He knew better than to argue with this pronouncement. He would only receive the standard recitation of her crypto-fascist morning regimen. Aerobics at six. A bowl of bran at seven. A meeting with the producer at seven-thirty. Makeup session at eight. A meeting with staff and crew from nine to nine-fifteen
column2: followed by promo shots for the next day’s show and a session in the green room with this morning’s guest celebrities. Life was a ballbuster for San Francisco’s most famous talk-show hostess."|"Significant Others"|"Armistead Maupin"

column1: ap 07:37|"Seven thirty-seven"|"He checked the clock. Seven thirty-seven. “O.K.
column2: Puppy
column3: go pick out a tape.” This was his usual ploy to get her out of the room while he pulled on his bathrobe. It was no big deal to him
column4: but Mary Ann thought it “inadvisable” that he walk around naked in front of Shawna. And Mary Ann should know; she was the one with the talk show."|"Significant Others"|"Armistead Maupin"

column1: ap 08:46|"eight forty-six"|"The clock said eight forty-six when he went to the window and peered down twenty-three stories into the leafy green canyon of Barbary Lane. From this height
column2: Anna Madrigal’s courtyard was nothing more than a terra-cotta postage stamp
column3: but he could still discern a figure moving jauntily along the perimeter."|"Significant Others"|"Armistead Maupin"

column1: ap 11:15|eleven-fifteen|"Whatever the cause
column2: something had soured the interview beyond repair
column3: so he decided against requesting an introduction after the show. Mary Ann had already obliged him with introductions to Huey Lewis
column4: Scott Madsen and Tina Turner. There was nothing to be gained by abusing the privilege.

column1: Besides
column2: it was eleven-fifteen
column3: and he had a nursery to run.

column1: The place had been his since 1984
column2: when his partner
column3: Ned Lockwood
column4: had moved back to L.A. The exhilaration of ownership had been a new experience for Michael
column5: prompting him to renovate and expand beyond his wildest imaginings. He had built a new greenhouse for the succulents
column7: then changed the name from God’s Green Earth to Plant Parenthood."|"Significant Others"|"Armistead Maupin"

column1: ap 08:00|"Eight o’clock"|"“Think about it
